Description:
Detects a potentially suspicious execution from an uncommon folder.

Author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Process Execution From A Potentially Suspicious Folder
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((process_path like '%:\perflogs\%' or process_path like '%:\users\all users\%' or process_path like '%:\users\default\%' or process_path like '%:\users\networkservice\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\addins\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\debug\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\fonts\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\help\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\ime\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\media\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\repair\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\security\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\system32\tasks\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\tasks\%' or process_path like '%$recycle.bin%' or process_path like '%\config\systemprofile\%' or process_path like '%\intel\logs\%' or process_path like '%\rsa\machinekeys\%') and  not (process_path like 'c:\users\public\ibm\clientsolutions\start_programs\%' or (process_path like 'c:\windows\syswow64\config\systemprofile\citrix\updaterbinaries\%' and process_path like '%\citrixreceiverupdater.exe')))
